info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 5:57PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS INCREASING COVERAGE AND INTENSITY ALONG THE I-69 CORRIDOR AND INTO THE DETROIT METRO AREA THIS EVENING... WEATHER... * Snow showers will increase coverage and intensity as strong cold front crosses the Port Huron, Pontiac, and Detroit metro areas to the Ohio border this evening. * Snow accumulations around 1 inch are expected between 6 PM and 10 PM as the pattern sweeps northwest to southeast. * Southwest to west wind gusting around 30 mph. IMPACTS... * Rapid reduction of visibility to near a quarter mile in spots with rapid fluctuations. * Untreated roads quickly become snow covered, particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
